ARABIC: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Ad were destroyed by a savage howling wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the 'Ad were destroyed by the furious cold blast of roaring wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind-storm
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Ads were destroyed by a swift, destructive gale
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And as for A’ad, they were destroyed by a severe thundering windstorm.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And as for `Ad, they were destroyed by a wind, Sarsar `Atiyah!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And as to Ad, they were destroyed by a roaring, violent blast.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and as for Ad, they were destroyed by a wind clamorous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And as for A'ad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and the 'Ad were destroyed by a furious wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And as for 'Aad they were destroyed by a wind, furious. roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And as for ‘Ad, they were destroyed by a fierce icy gale,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious Wind, exceedingly violent;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And as for 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious violent wind;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: as for Aad, they were destroyed by a howling, violent wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And as for Aad; they were annihilated by a furious, roaring wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:6] And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a deafening, intensely clamorous, violent wind, [that was] powerful and severe [in its assault] upon ‘Ād, despite their power and might.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And as for 'Aad) the people of Hud, (they were destroyed by a fierce roaring wind) cold wind that disobeyed and rebelled against its wardens,
